channel.title: Music of Black Mesa Source
channel.description:
I think that the music that should be put in BM:S should really tie into the style that Valve has used for the HL series. For example, in HL2 Eps 2, the part after where you first confront an observer or whatever they're called, the music that was set for when you were fighting the combine was really good. Like it wanted me to kick some combine ass but while jamming out.
I sampled some of your guys' music while searchin through the site and yeah it's good, but I downloaded the HiRes version of HL2 before where it amped up the graphics of HL2 and also changed the music to Batman Begins which was nice. It synced up and went right through the game, but I do love the music from Valve. I've been tempted to buy the songs off itunes for HL2 Eps 2 even though they're like a few minutes or shorter.
So, final thought, try and change some of the music for BM:S so it feels really in tune and make me wanna bob my head at the same time at points

item.description:
BloodHK47:

Like this picture, I’ve seen that from TF2 before so is some of the stuff from TF2 also used for BMS?

OMGosh… I’ve never seen that in TF2! That’s the Black Mesa logo!

EDIT: Oops! I think I did a little unintended necroposting right there…

Read full topic

item.title: Music of Black Mesa Source
item.dc:creator: Daytanoff
item.description:
First of all, thank you for working on such a project,it must take some guts to stand up to thousands of people and confront their expectations.
I downloaded the 6 music from this site and they are great.
But I am wondering what they will “sound” like in BM…Considering BM as Halfe-Life 1 remastered.
I am not questionning anyone’s capabilities,I am just curious and maybe a bit anxious as to how much the spirit of HL is going to be present in BM…
Maybe a quick video with a music posted on your Youtube chanel would satisfy some of us ?
Anywho,thanks again for your work,cannot wait to see the result wether it is Valve-like or a new HL or anything else.
Big up

Read full topic

item.title: Music of Black Mesa Source

I used the first person pronoun and was describing my own experience (you even underlined the appropriate part of my post already), which fits neither scenario you just posited. Checkmate, muthafucka.

item.title: Music of Black Mesa Source
item.dc:creator: ManlyStump
item.description:
raw_bean:

Is it me or can you not just extract the mp3s from your game files? I have all the HL1/HL2/Ep1/Ep2 soundtrack files plus Still Alive in my music library already and if I needed to go online at all it was just to get GCFScape or to find the right folder location to look in.

Or to download the games from Steam in the first place

Stewy:

PS: What do people have with cats these day’s?

Whatever that cat ate in the previous 12-18 hours.

Read full topic

Just buy AudioSurf, it comes with the entire Orange Box soundtrack. Or just download the demo, and copy the soundtrack folder over.

Is it me or can you not just extract the mp3s from your game files? I have all the HL1/HL2/Ep1/Ep2 soundtrack files plus Still Alive in my music library already and if I needed to go online at all it was just to get GCFScape or to find the right folder location to look in.
